As waves of smaller programs attacked him, Azureblade felt more and
more ir=
ritated. The antiviruses weren't specifically designed to hurt
him as a spa=
rk, and so were only an annoyance, but he simply couldn't
break that comput=
er! Well, if he couldn't fight it on its own terms,
he'd have to use the be=
st method ever used: Kicking the damn thing
till it would either do what he=
 wanted it to or stop working altogether.

He found out where the actual co=
mputers were located in the ship. He
got out and flew there in a moment. 

=
He soon found the main power entry for the computer. Using his spark's
ener=
gy, he sent jolts of electricity on the actual rubber casing for
about 10 n=
anocycles. With the extra heat in the room, fire would catch
on fast.
